tit.e: Genroin gikan (Councilor of the Chamber of Elders)
Genroin gikan (Councilor of the Chamber of Elders)
Genroin gikan (Councilor of the Chamber of Elders)

sen.j: 元老院議官（げんろういんぎかん）は、元老院 (日本)を組織した人員。
sen.e: Genroin gikan were those who organized the Chamber of Elders (Japan).
Genroin gikan were those who organized the Chamber of Elders (Japan).
Genroin gikan were those who organized the Chamber of Elders (Japan).

sen.j: 明治後期よりおかれた役職で天皇の重臣であった元老とは直接の関係はない。
sen.e: It was a post set up in the late Meiji period, and had no direct connection with Genro who were senior vassals of the Emperor.
It was a post set up in the late Meiji period, and had no direct connection with Genro who were senior vassals of the Emperor.
It was a post set up in the late Meiji period, and had no direct connection with Genro who were senior vassals of the Emperor.

sen.j: 華族・官吏・学識者の中から勅任官された。
sen.e: They were appointed by the Emperor from among the peerage, government officials and academics.
They were appointed by the Emperor from among the peerage, government officials and academics.
They were appointed by the Emperor from among the peerage, government officials and academics.

sen.j: 1890年帝国議会開設のため廃止された。
sen.e: It was abolished in 1890 due to the establishment of Imperial Diet
It was abolished in 1890 due to the establishment of Imperial Diet.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオド追加しました。
sen.e: It was abolished in 1890 due to the establishment of Imperial Diet.

sen.j: 有栖川宮熾仁親王：明治8年7月2日から議官、明治9年5月18日から議長。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Teruhito: He became the councilor on July 2, 1875, and the chairman on May 18, 1986.
Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Teruhito: He became the councilor on July 2, 1875, and the chairman on May 18, 1876.
Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Teruhito: He became the councilor on July 2, 1875, and the chairman on May 18, 1876.

sen.j: 陸軍大将・参謀総長。
sen.e: He was an Army General and the Chief of the General staff.
He was an Army General and the Chief of the General staff.
He was an Army General and the Chief of the General staff.

sen.j: 伊集院兼寛：明治11年 -。
sen.e: Kanehiro IJUIN: He became a councilor in 1878.
Kanehiro IJUIN: He became a councilor in 1878.

sen.j: 子爵・貴族院議員
sen.e: He was a viscount and a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 子爵・麝香間祗候・貴族院議員・京都府権知事・大阪府大参事
sen.e: He was a viscount, a Jako-no-ma shiko (Jako Hall attendance), a member of the House of Peers, the Kyoto prefectural governor, and a secretary of Osaka Prefecture.
He was a viscount, Jako-no-ma shiko (Jako Hall attendance), member of the House of Peers, the Kyoto prefectural governor, and secretary of Osaka Prefecture.

sen.e: He was a viscount, Jako-no-ma shiko (Jako Hall attendance), member of the House of Peers, the Kyoto prefectural governor, and secretary of Osaka Prefecture.

sen.e: Michitoshi IWAMURA: He was a baron, a minister of Agriculture and Commerce, an Imperial court councilor and the Director General of the Hokkaido government (1886-1947).

sen.j: 男爵。

sen.j: 工部大学校校長・学習院院長・華族女学校校長・清国駐剳特命全権公使・韓国駐剳特命全権公使・枢密顧問官。
sen.e: He was the principal of the Imperial College of Engineer and Kazoku Jogakko (girl's school for Kazoku new nobility), the Qing resident envoy extraordinary and minister plenipotentiary, and a Privy Council.

He was the principal of the Imperial College of Engineer and principal of both Gakushuin and Kazoku Jogakko (girl's school for Kazoku new nobility), resident envoy extraordinary and minister plenipotentiary of Qing and Korea, and a Privy Council.
